1. Introduction

Unmanned Aircraft (UA) or Remotely Piloted Aircraft System (RPAS),commonly
known as “Drone” is considered to be a game-changer technology in modern life.
Drones are being extensively used for various applications. However, drones may also
be used for destructive purposes such as delivering explosives and harmful cargo for
creating havoc etc,

Drones also have the potential for disrupting manned aireraft movements especially in
the proximity to airports. There are numerous examples of hours-long hold up of
airport operations due drone sightings like Gatwick and Dubai airports. Such incidents
have led the aviation community and security agencies tv consider the deployment of
counter-drone systems by airport operators to protect airports and their proximities to
protect the airports from rogue drones

2. System Description

The Counter Drone System should provide Multi Sensor based complete and
comprehensive solution with regards to drone detection, tracking, identification and
neutralization (Soft Kills and Hard kill options). Soft-kill options will not work if the
unmanned aircraft employs navigation through INS or VPS and is not remotely
piloted i.e. fully autonomous. Hence the neutralization by hard kill measures such as
laser, and Fire Control locking system is inevitable. The decision to employ such hard
kill measures shall be depending on the situations and specific to the airport as per
SOP. The hard kill option will be the last resort for drone neutralization. If the hard
kill option is decided then, the laser will be the first hard kill option for drone
neutralization

‘The solution should integrate detection, identification and engagement sub-systems
and provide operator with a composite air situational picture as well as tools for
managing response.

‘The salient features of Counter Drone system are given below

a. The Counter UAV solution should be effective and efficient in all-weather
conditions with minimum of 95% detection and neutralization probability of all
drones with or without RF command and control and data link.

b. The C-UAS solution should simultaneously detect, identify and neutralize
multiple / swarm of drones (minimum 20 Nos).

c, Operation of the counter drone solution in no case should interfere with RF
environment of Airport operations.

4. The deployment of Counter Unmanned Aireraft system (C-UAS)

Counter unmanned aircraft system needs to be deployed in the airport to protect the
airspace from unauthorized unmanned aircraft / rogue drone in and around airfield. In
the approach funnel area, the coverage shall be approximately 10 KMs and other
direction of airfield it shall be around 05 KMs radius,

The number of Counter Unmanned Aircraft system (C-UAS) to be deployed in
particular airfield is depending on the geographical conditions of that airfield and
availability of Line of sight coverage and area to be covered. All the counter drone
system deployed in any airfield needs to be integrated in the Command and Control
Center (CCC).
